column5: It's that time of year again here in the North country, the time when winter finally releases her grip on our local lakes and rivers.   :thumbsup_anim: Got the boat out and had a little fun trolling for pike and lakers today with a decent number brought to hand but no giants. Here's a couple of shots from the day.   Old man winter is reluctant to let go.      One of a bunch of good eater lakers today.
That first shot just made me go bbbbrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!
Ice in June should be against the law......
Great stuff!  It shouldn't mess with my head that you still have ice.....but it does    Love the yellow fins on that laker
That's awesome. I can't beleive that you still got ice, we didn't have that much on most of our lakes all winter lol.  Nice fish as well. You live in a awesome place that's forsure.
Great Scott !!!!!!!!!!!Ice on the water!!!  yer a hearty breed to be livin up there The beauty of the lanscape makes up for the chilly willy weather i bet!!
Cool stuff Dave!  My buddy up there is surely looking forward to spring too.. with one on the way.  Fish will be safe from him this season methinks.
Nice pics it sure looks a lot nicer there then here thanks for sharing
Ice... I had to check the date on your post twice! What beautiful colours on that Laker... Very nice!
wow that is a beauty laker for sure  ....
We had something icee like that down here yesterday....it was a slurpee from 7/11. Very nice fish.   Art
Beautiful fish. I'm partial to the 78deg water myself, ice in June, no thanks.
